question.text:
Grafting is a technique, which involves,

i. A connection between the root system of two different plants.
ii. A composite plant production.
iii. The physical and physiological joining of two separate individuals.
iv. The plants used are non-cambium containing ones.

solution.text: Grafting is a technique of connecting two parts, usually a root system and a shoot system of two different plants in such a way that they unite and later develop as a composite plant. It is the physical and physiological joining of separate individuals. It is used only in cambium containing woody eustelic plants. A small shoot of the plant with superior characters is employed. It is called graft or scion. It should have one to several buds.
